description: A team sport where two teams of eleven players compete to score goals by getting a ball into the opposing team's net using any part of the body except arms and hands.
A bat-and-ball game played between two teams where players score runs, bowl, and field with a unique set of rules and traditions.
A combat sport involving sword fighting between two competitors using one of three weapons: foil, épée, or sabre.
An athletic style of street dance combining rhythmic movements, acrobatics, and creative footwork performed to hip-hop music.
An aquatic sport where athletes perform acrobatic movements while jumping from various heights into water.
A water sport where athletes compete to swim various distances using different strokes in the fastest time possible.
A precision sport where players use various clubs to hit a small ball into holes on a course in the fewest possible strokes.
A racket sport where players hit a ball back and forth over a net, scoring points when opponents fail to return the ball.
A cycling sport performed on BMX bikes over dirt tracks with jumps, berms, and other obstacles.
A collection of sporting events involving horseback riding, including dressage, jumping, and eventing.
A variant of volleyball played on sand with two players per team, requiring specific techniques adapted for the beach environment.
A precision sport where athletes use bows to shoot arrows at targets from various distances.
A racket sport where players hit a shuttlecock back and forth across a net, requiring quick reflexes and strategic placement.
A bat-and-ball sport where two teams alternate between batting and fielding, aiming to score runs while preventing the opposition from scoring.
A water sport where athletes propel boats using oars, competing in various boat classes over different distances.
A full-contact team sport where players carry, pass, and kick the ball to score points while tackling opponents.
A precision sport where athletes use various types of firearms to shoot at stationary or moving targets.
A team sport played on horseback where players use mallets to drive a ball into the opposing team's goal.
A team sport where players score points by throwing a ball through the opposing team's elevated hoop while following dribbling rules.
A Korean martial art characterized by high, fast kicking techniques and dynamic striking movements.
A team sport where players hit a ball over a net, with each team allowed three touches to return the ball to the opposing court.
A fast-paced racket sport played on a table where players hit a lightweight ball back and forth over a net.
A Japanese martial art focusing on striking techniques such as punching, kicking, knee strikes, and elbow strikes.
A combat sport involving grappling techniques such as throws, takedowns, and pins to gain physical advantage over an opponent.
A team sport where two teams of eleven players compete to score goals by getting a ball into the opposing team's net using any part of the body except arms and hands.
A combat sport where two competitors throw punches at each other while wearing protective gloves in a boxing ring.
A sport involving exercises requiring balance, strength, flexibility, agility, coordination, and grace across various apparatus.
